businessProfile.name: Romeo Pizzeria
businessProfile.address: 134-24 Cross Bay Blvd, Jamaica, NY 11417, USA
businessProfile.formatted_address: 134-24 Cross Bay Blvd, Jamaica, NY 11417, USA

reviews.text: My girls love this pizza spot. They are little pizza critics only the best will do. Next time I'm craving pizza i will have to sit inside. I love the drink selection an seating. Would not recommend bringing a stroller inside.

Romeo‚Äôs Pizza

Layout/atmosphere
*Five tables

Food/drink
*Regular slice - solid
*Grandma slice - solid; garlic cloves

This place holds its own and then some in a tough market. It's a mile from New Park Pizza which is a mile from your other neighborhood favorite and your friend's favorite spot and so on. The pizza is great, the people are friendly and the price is perfect. They helped me waterproof my order tonight to walk back home in the rain and the crust on the other end was still delightful.

Best pizzeria in the neighborhood! My husband is New Park all the way, but I will ALWAYS pick ROMEOS on crossbay time and time again. Their sauce is so flavorful and their Sicilian slices are the best and my go to. Crispy yet fluffy. Thank you Romeos for being a classic staple in the community!

Went to have lunch today with my wife at Romeo‚Äôs and the food was outstanding. The server was unbelievable. What a great guy took care of us. Well, I enjoyed the food the apples everything was so delicious. Can‚Äôt wait to go back.

editorial_summary.overview: Cozy neighborhood pizzeria serving a wide menu of thin-crust pies, subs & familiar pasta dishes.

detailedReviews.text: I usually order my pizza as delivery, but when I do show up they treat the customers very well. Pizza is GREAT!

detailedReviews.author: ritchieKING ROM√ÅN
detailedReviews.text: Really good food and reminds me of my uncle's pizzeria where I worked as a teenager and the taste had a fresh Italian piece of southern Italia to its the margherita pizza was made with fresh ingredients and the marinara was very acidic but also had a good flavor of garlic in it not too much onions because he hated when I put too much sugar and onions in our marinara sauce but loved his garlic just like me and I would overload the marinara sauce with garlic and pepper flakes in order to make it a little bit more savory and spicy than sweeter and acidic but because we didn't want people getting sick and having to go to a doctor after a few weeks and months we didn't want to use too much butter to cut down the acid and started pureeing the carrots and using the natural sugar to cut the acidity of the tomatoes in the marinara sauce but the pizza sauce was very good and I loved the fresh basil leads and mozzarella on the pizza slices was a great choice to make at romeos only if they had a brick oven it would taste like it came straight from Italy to the storefront like across the street at new park pizza shop and they don't know how to make it like romeo's does if only they were combined to be one entity but new park only does pizza while romeos is full service pizza spot on crossbay.

detailedReviews.author: Rich
detailedReviews.text: Counter person was very welcoming and took my order right of way. 2 sandwiches and chicken fingers. Was told 10 minute wait. 10 minutes later counter person brings out food to me. Excellent service and great food.

detailedReviews.author: Santiago Naranjo
detailedReviews.text: I ate there pepperoni pizza and my day got so much better would really recommend

detailedReviews.author: Matthew Diaz
detailedReviews.text: I've only ordered to pick up and it's usually either a pizza pie or chicken wings. Both are delicious. The space inside is small but there are chairs and tables. The service is good.

detailedReviews.author: Jayne Cutrone
detailedReviews.text: We order from here once a week! You have to try the eggplant ricotta or the hot honey pepperoni with vodka sauce pizza‚Ä¶ OMG you will never go anywhere else!!! Best pizza ever, super fast delivery, reasonable prices, and very friendly staff.

detailedReviews.author: John Zaun
detailedReviews.text:
I remember when Romeo owned this pizzeria and made good food. When he and his son died (tragic story) and these young guys bought it, it turned into total mediocrity ...
Bland dough that is often very undercooked. Very light on the mozzarella, which tastes more like food vendor bought junk that's overly salted to create some flavor as opposed to authentic Italian made mozzarella with that depth of flavor, and a thick sauce more in line with a Bolognese or marinara made from a mirapoux or sofrito mixture than an actual pizza sauce simmered in large pots for 6, 7, 8 hours straight to create that bitter-free, rich pizza sauce taste.
Is there worse pizza? By far, so I won't say don't come here. Hell right across the street is even worse. But if you're looking for what this Ozone Park/Howard Beach area is really known for (some of the best Pizza in all of the 5 boroughs, being a true old school Italian neighborhood) than gona few blocks down in either direction and look for New Park or Ozone Pizza

customerMoodAnalysis.sentimentSummary: Customers are genuinely thrilled with their experience. With an average 4.6/5 rating across 100 recent reviews, your restaurant consistently exceeds expectations.

strengthsPerceived: Customers consistently praise the flavorful sauce and perfectly balanced Sicilian slices, describing them as crispy yet fluffy. - social media marketing can showcase this strength
The friendly and attentive service, highlighted by a server who made a lasting impression, enhances the dining experience. - review management can highlight this positive aspect
The pizza crust is consistently praised for being perfectly cooked, neither undercooked nor overcooked, which is a common issue elsewhere. - SEO services can leverage this for better visibility
improvementOpportunities: Negative reviews about the quality and consistency of the pizza (e.g., undercooked, bland dough, overly salted mozzarella) - review management can address this concern
Complaints about high prices compared to competitors (e.g., $22 for a small pie) - social media marketing can improve this area
Lack of awareness about the restaurant's atmosphere and offerings - social media marketing can improve this area
